awd_titl_txt: Dissertation Research:  Urban and Rural Views of            Reproduction in Senegal
awd_abstract_narration: 9317488  Pelto    This project involves the dissertation research of  a cultural anthropologist from the University of  Connecticut.  The student will study changing  beliefs about reproduction and sexual behavior  among young men and women in Senegal, West Africa.  It will examine how changes in wage labor,  migration and education patterns affect  reproduction-related strategies. Using  ethnographic research methods of intensive  interviews, surveys and focus-group interviews in  Dakar, the capital city, and in a rural village,  the student will try to understand how young  people conceptualize their sexual behavior and its  relation to STDs.   This research is important because AIDS and other  STDs are a major public health issue all over the  world, and particularly in Africa.  Advances in  our understanding of how young people think about  their sexual behavior can help public health  officials deal with the problem.  ***
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Behavioral and Cognitive Sciences
